greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of partitions of n^2 into exactly n nonzero squares.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..200
example: a(2) = 0: there is no partition of 4 into exactly 2 nonzero squares.
maple: b:= proc(n, i, t) option remember; `if`(n=0, 1, `if`(i<1 or
mathematica: h[n_] := h[n] = If[n < 1, 0, If[Sqrt[n] // IntegerQ, n, h[n - 1]]];
a[n_] := Function[s, b[s, s, n] - If[n == 0, 0, b[s, s, n - 1]]][n^2];
a /@ Range[0, 40] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Nov 06 2020, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
program: def A319435List(n): return GeneralizedEulerTransform(n, lambda n: n^2)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 18 2018
